synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves mixing lithium sulfide, lithium oxide, phosphorus pentasulfide, and silicon sulfide powders in a glove box under an argon atmosphere to create a raw material composition, milling the mixture in a planetary ball mill for 40 hours to obtain an amorphous ion conductive material, transferring the powder to a carbon-coated quartz tube, vacuum-sealing, heating in a furnace to 550Â°C for 8 hours, and then slowly cooling to room temperature to produce a crystalline sulfide solid electrolyte material with a composition of Li3.4Si0.4P0.6(S0.9O0.1).
